configure.p: The TextFileWriter actor reads a string token and writes it, without any enclosing quotation marks, to a file. The actor outputs the file path of the generated file.

The path and name of the output file are specified via input ports. Specify whether the input is appended to the specified file (if it exists), or if an existing file is overwritten via the changeExisting parameter.
The TextFileWriter is similar to the FileWriter actor, except that the TextFileWriter actor does not add line breaks to its output, while the FileWriter actor does.

property.name: port:fileToWrite
property.configure: An input port that accepts the file path of the file to which to write. See FileParameter for more information about specifying file names.

property.name: port:string
property.configure: An input port that receives a string token to write-one line at a time--to a file.

property.name: port:fileWritten
property.configure: An output port that broadcasts the name and path of the output file.

property.name: prop:Change existing
property.configure: Specify whether the input is appended to the specified file (if it exists), or if an existing file is overwritten.
